Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: Gentle Kobold Tradeshop

A heavy, green filigreed wooden door lends a bit of light to the Gentle Kobold Tradeshop, and various plants give the place a homey feel. A green rug takes up the majority of the floor in the center of the room and cushions the sound of creaking floorboards beneath. The large sales counter is a predominant feature in the room standing flush with the west wall, below an unavoidably visible flag hung on the wall behind it. A potted petunia plant is sitting next to the display cabinet in the southeast corner of the room. A potted philodendron in the southwest corner beside the sales counter. Opposite of the petunia plant is a mottled feldgrau soft leather and ash cushioned chair in the northeast corner.

Opposite of the petunia plant is a mottled feldgrau soft leather and ash cushioned chair in the northeast corner.

A green rug takes up the majority of the floor in the center of the room and cushions the sound of creaking floorboards beneath. a heavy, green filigreed wooden door leading north
You see a heavy wooden door that has been painted green. It has been masterfully decorated with a copper filigreed pattern around a frosted glass window pane. $(parent-desc)
the northeast corner
The northeast corner of the room. A mottled feldgrau soft leather and ash cushioned chair is sitting here.
The northeast corner of the room. A mottled feldgrau soft leather and ash cushioned chair is sitting here.
the northwest corner
The northwest corner of the room. There is a potted petunia plant here.
The northwest corner of the room. There is a potted petunia plant here.
the southeast corner
The southeast corner of the room. You see some bonsai plants here.
The southeast corner of the room. You see some bonsai plants here.
the southwest corner
The southwest corner of the room. A potted philodendron plant is here.
The southwest corner of the room. A potted philodendron plant is here.
the east wall

The gray stone eastern wall was laid on a base of peastone gravel which fills a twenty-one inch trench. The larger blocks are placed at the bottom and the lesser stones set upon those. For stability, the higher stones slant towards the center, therefore it is thinner near the ceiling. All the cracks and crevices are filled with minor stones and gravel to complete the wall and prevent light or weather from filtering through. The wall is approximately ten feet in height. A display cabinet is in front of the wall just south of a mottled feldgrau soft leather and ash cushioned chair.

The wall is approximately ten feet in height. A display cabinet is in front of the wall just south of a mottled feldgrau soft leather and ash cushioned chair.
the north wall

The gray stone northern wall was laid on a base of peastone gravel which fills a twenty-one inch trench. The larger blocks are placed at the bottom and the lesser stones set upon those. For stability, the higher stones slant towards the center, therefore it is thinner near the ceiling. All the cracks and crevices are filled with minor stones and gravel to complete the wall and prevent light or weather from filtering through. The wall is approximately ten feet in height. It has a a heavy, green filigreed wooden door that let's in a bit of light through a frosted glass window.

The wall is approximately ten feet in height. It has a a heavy, green filigreed wooden door that let's in a bit of light through a frosted glass window.
the south wall

The gray stone southern wall was laid on a base of peastone gravel which fills a twenty-one inch trench. The larger blocks are placed at the bottom and the lesser stones set upon those. For stability, the higher stones slant towards the center, therefore it is thinner near the ceiling. All the cracks and crevices are filled with minor stones and gravel to complete the wall and prevent light or weather from filtering through. The wall is approximately ten feet in height. A large shamrock green tower embroidered broadcloth flag is hanging here.

The gray stone southern wall was laid on a base of peastone gravel which fills a twenty-one inch trench. The larger blocks are placed at the bottom and the lesser stones set upon those. The wall is approximately ten feet in height. A large shamrock green tower embroidered broadcloth flag is hanging here.
the west wall

The gray stone western wall was laid on a base of peastone gravel which fills a twenty-one inch trench. The larger blocks are placed at the bottom and the lesser stones set upon those. For stability, the higher stones slant towards the center, therefore it is thinner near the ceiling. All the cracks and crevices are filled with minor stones and gravel to complete the wall and prevent light or weather from filtering through. The wall is approximately ten feet in height. There is a bookshelf here.

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[S] \{ A short plump woman and a short heavyset woman bump into one another behind a large oak sales counter. A short plump woman grumbles something under her breath. \| A short heavyset woman hums quietly to herself until she is abruptly shushed by a short plump woman. She purses her lips and mutters, "...you're prickly today," before going about her business. \| A short heavyset woman \{ whispers some words of encouragement to a potted petunia plant. \| checks the soil in a potted philodendron. \| says a quiet prayer as she patiently prunes a bonsai tree. \} \| A short plump woman stoically cleans a smudge from a heavy, green filigreed wooden door's frosted glass window. \| A short heavyset woman offers a springerle cookie to a short plump woman with a smile, who pauses a moment and reluctantly takes the sweet treat. \| A fly lands on an aloe-vera plant for a rest. \| A fly buzzes around a short plump woman's ear before she swats at the air with a quiet grunt. \}
